title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&v=enabled&s=ae6b7a10fa3272821e9904431dab0b993b36aae7
comments:
I watched Happy Family on Prime. They couldn't replicate the magic of Sarabhai vs Sarabhai & Khichdi.

Atul Kulkarni was surprisingly good in comic role though.


Watched The Pitchers S2, I felt it somehow glorified the toxic work culture in I.T. based startups.
Where to watch Succession S4 in India?

Am I the only one who didn't like john wick 4?

And mandalorian s03e07 was awesome.
Scott Pilgrim is so funny and entertaining even after 13 years, its kind of unbelievable.
Listened to this week LPOTL episode,good as always,Also finished Mr Robot S2 gawd it's good. Trying to complete Twin peaks.
John Wick 3 was the best. That said 2nd half of John Wick 4 was really good but 1st half was crap

Watched the old movie : Ijaazat. Stunned by the songs this album has, the lyrics are by far the best I have heard.

Also, a great movie. Way ahead of it's time :)

Edit: Watch > watched
Watched Damini, a stupendous movie. Didn't know Amir Khan also had an appearance.
Those watching succession should also watch Barry. It's on the same level.
Is anyone watching vinland saga season 2?
